data.title: Equatorial Guinea：Rich Central African Country with Beautiful Sightseeing Spots – skyticket Travel Guide
data.meta_description: Officially known as the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, Equatorial Guinea is a small country situated in Central Africa. ...
data.text:
table of contents

[x] close

Officially known as the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, Equatorial Guinea is a small country situated in Central Africa. Equatorial Guinea has the richest economy in Africa in terms of wealth per capita. This is mainly due to the fact that Equatorial Guinea is the biggest oil producer in sub-Saharan Africa. Despite being a small country relative to its African neighbors, Equatorial Guinea boasts of amazing sightseeing spots. If you are planning your visit to this country, here is a list of some of the best sightseeing places in Equatorial Guinea.

1. Catedral de Santa Isabel (Malabo)

Photo by Embassy of Equatorial Guinea

First on this list is the Catedral de Santa Isabel. Located in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea is this calm, peaceful worship place. This church is famous in Equatorial Guinea as the sightseeing spot that perfectly represents local architecture and culture. Most photographers regard this place as one of the best places for photography and sightseeing. If you are looking for an authentic Equatorial Guinea experience, the Catedral de Santa Isabel is the best place for you.

2. Nuevo Estadio de Malabo (Malabo)

Photo by commons.wikimedia.org

Another sightseeing spot in Equatorial Guinea is the Nuevo Estadio de Malabo located in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea. Sports lovers will love the sight of this magnificent stadium. This sports area is one of the cleanest attractions in Equatorial Guinea. It also has good food places and good lodging areas. The pleasant environment is perfect for peaceful relaxation. Don’t forget to include this place in your list of must-visit spots in Equatorial Guinea.

3. La Casa Verde (Malabo)

Photo by commons.wikimedia.org

Located just a few steps from Catedral de Santa Isabel is La Casa Verde. This cozy-looking house is an iconic sightseeing spot in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea. Although entry to the building requires proper permit, the view of the outside is quite stunning. You would not want to miss a good photo opportunity with La Casa Verde. The view on the inside takes you back to the age before the independence of Equatorial Guinea, which is why it is also worth the visit. If you are visiting Equatorial Guinea, make sure to drop by La Casa Verde!

4. Bata Cathedral (Bata)

Photo by alarico/shutterstock

Next to our list of the best sightseeing places in Equatorial Guinea is the Bata Cathedral. Located in Bata, Equatorial Guinea, this church is home to superb artworks drawn on its ceilings. Dating back to the 1950s, this cathedral is an iconic sightseeing spot in Equatorial Guinea. Most tourists go to this place to worship and admire the artistic design of the church. If you are visiting Equatorial Guinea, drop by Bata Cathedral and prepare your cameras for the perfect photo shoot.

5. The Malabo National Park (Malabo)

Another amazing sightseeing spot in Equatorial Guinea is the Malabo National Park. Lovers of nature will surely enjoy visiting this place. The surroundings are clean and calm. There is also a restaurant and some activity areas. If you want to do cycling and boating in Equatorial Guinea, this park is the place to go. The trees and plants provide a refreshing experience. You can also go for short walks or jog around this park. If you are going to visit Equatorial Guinea, be sure to drop by the Malabo National Park to enjoy the beauty African nature.

6. Arena Blanca (Luba)

If you are into swimming and recreation, you may want to visit the Arena Blanca. Arena Blanca is considered to be one of the best swimming sites and beaches in Equatorial Guinea. This beach is located in Luba, Bioko Island, Equatorial Guinea, and is visited by many tourists throughout the year. Enjoy the clear blue waters of the Atlantic Ocean. There are not many establishments, so it is advisable that you bring your own food and drinks. Arena Blanca is definitely a must-visit sightseeing spot!

7. Centro Cultural de Espana en Malabo (Malabo)

Photo by commons.wikimedia.org

Last on this list of the best sightseeing places in Equatorial Guinea is the Centro Cultural de Espana en Malabo located in Park of the AVAS Africa, Malabo, Equatorial Guinea. This cultural center is home to many interactive activities including workshops, recording, and other artistic expressions. Infrastructures in this center include libraries, cafeteria, offices, and training and rehearsal rooms. This place is a must-visit for lovers of the Equatorial Guinea culture!

◎Closing

If you are going to visit the amazing country of Equatorial Guinea, be sure to visit the places mentioned in this list in order to have a complete experience of the country. Enjoy your vacation and sightseeing in this Central African country!
